instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_S4: What is 3V3_S4? This is an abbreviation of PP3V3_S4, a 3.3v power rail when the machine is in an S4 state. .
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PP5V_S4: What is PP5V_S4? PP5V_S4 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
This board came in for no power; PPBUS was shorted, inject 1V and took off the bad cap, which was <CAPACITOR>C7324</CAPACITOR>.. now PPBUS is clear of short. 
But the board is still not powering on; after visual inspection I found out that had corrosion on pin #2 and #3.. I replaced the chip and the board is still refusing to power on.. 
Although the symptoms are different where I get a fan spin.. then stop.. then a continuous fan spin.. if I unplug and replug.. I get no fan whatsoever.. 

When then fan spins I get <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL>.. Any clue on where to look?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Bypass, or replace F7140; possible internal failure.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Iâ€™ll do that tomorrow. Its weird that its either as simple as just replacing a fuse or an internal failure.

question: can i use just a wire instead of F7140 just for testing purposes?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Fuse replaced; still behaving the same..
I really cannot rely on voltage readings because when I start probing around.. PPBUS or <SIGNAL>3V3_S4</SIGNAL> or anything the fan spins..
So I took the diode mode readings of all power rails and it all seems to fit with 1. FlexBV (although my readings were higher in all readings I guess that's for the multimeter differences) and 2. another board that I have.

What was a bit suspicious to <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> so I replaced <CHIP>U8005</CHIP>; same issue
also <SIGNAL>PP1V05S0_DRVH_R</SIGNAL> was kinda weird going up then down.. I replaced both <CHIP>U7600</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7630</TRANSISTOR>; same issue

Dunno what's wrong with this board.. it was supposed to be a clean easy job of <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>; take it off and boom happy <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
When the fan starts to spin, do you get CPU core voltage?
Are you using original Magsafe 2 charger?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Yes I use an original MagSafe 2 charger. 
When the fan spins yes CPU core voltages are there.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Check if board turns on always out of case.
If yes, check then <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and USB activity.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Yes; turns on out of case. 
<SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3v 
USB mouse turns on the laser

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
You should use better way to confirm USB activity.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]

If board really boots always out of case, then put it back and start connecting devices one by one.
See when the problem appears.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
No USB Activity, sadly. 

The computer is behaving weirdly I'm going to describe it as much as I can: 
A normal bare board power on behavior for <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> when you plug in the MagSafe charger should be a take a few seconds to turn on the fan then a continuous fan spin remains. 

This board is different; I don't get the fan spin as soon as I plug in the charger.. I might get it 30 seconds after or "randomly" when I probe around areas.. and now (I say now because it's different than it used to) when the fan spins it does for 5 seconds then it shuts off..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Check if fan spins when start with LIO flex disconnected; keep connected only power cable between LIO and MLB.

When fan stops, which voltages remain on the MLB?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Without the LIO flex cable connected the fan is not spinning at all.. I gave it its time; nothing.. I probed around; nothing.

I started measuring for voltages; 
PPBUS = 8.6v
RTC = 3.3v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> = 5V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S4</SIGNAL> = not there. diode mode 0.440
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> not there. diode more 0.500

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
May have accumulated crap underneath CPU.
You can try heating it with quality flux.

I also recommend to reball SMC.
